com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.frame_body

Class ID3v24FrameBody

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.beaglebuddy.util.Utility
      • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.frame_body.ID3v24FrameBodyUtility
        • com.beaglebuddy.id3.v24.frame_body.ID3v24FrameBody
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    ID3v24FrameBodyAttachedPicture, ID3v24FrameBodyAudioEncryption, ID3v24FrameBodyAudioSeekPointIndex, ID3v24FrameBodyComments, ID3v24FrameBodyCommercial, ID3v24FrameBodyEncryptionMethodRegistration, ID3v24FrameBodyEqualization, ID3v24FrameBodyEventTimingCodes, ID3v24FrameBodyGeneralEncapsulatedObject, ID3v24FrameBodyGroupIdentificationRegistration, ID3v24FrameBodyInvolvedPeopleList, ID3v24FrameBodyLinkedInformation, ID3v24FrameBodyMPEGLocationLookupTable, ID3v24FrameBodyMusicCDIdentifier, ID3v24FrameBodyOwnership, ID3v24FrameBodyPlayCounter, ID3v24FrameBodyPopularimeter, ID3v24FrameBodyPositionSynchronization, ID3v24FrameBodyPrivate, ID3v24FrameBodyRecommendedBufferSize, ID3v24FrameBodyRelativeVolumeAdjustment, ID3v24FrameBodyReverb, ID3v24FrameBodySeek, ID3v24FrameBodySignature, ID3v24FrameBodySynchronizedLyricsText, ID3v24FrameBodySynchronizedTempoCodes, ID3v24FrameBodyTermsOfUse, ID3v24FrameBodyTextInformation, ID3v24FrameBodyUniqueFileIdentifier, ID3v24FrameBodyUnsynchronizedLyrics, ID3v24FrameBodyURLLink, ID3v24FrameBodyUserDefinedTextInformation, ID3v24FrameBodyUserDefinedURLLink

    public class ID3v24FrameBody
extends ID3v24FrameBodyUtility

    This is the base class for all ID3v2.4 frame bodies. Although ID3v2.4 defines 83 different types of frames, many groups of frame bodies have the same fields, and thus are implemented by a single class. For example, there are 45 text information frames, and thus the corresponding frame bodies are implemented in one ID3v24FrameBodyTextInformation class. Similarly, there are 8 url link frames, but all are implemented using the ID3v24FrameBodyURLLink class.

    Each frame body has a raw, binary buffer, which is nothing more than a byte array. This is what is read in from the .mp3 file. This byte array holds all of the values for a given frame body. When a frame body is read in from an .mp3 file (more accurately, from the ID3v2.4 tag in the .mp3 file), this binary buffer is parsed and the values are stored in the frame body's data members. Users are then free to change the values of the frame body's data members. When the user is finished making changes, he must call the setBuffer() method in order to write all the frame body's data members back to the binary buffer, before calling save(OutputStream). However, you should not be invoking these methods, as calling MP3.save() will handle all of this for you.

    See Also:
    ID3 tag version 2.4.0 standard, wikipedia history of ID3 tags

    • Field Detail

      • buffer

        protected byte[] buffer

      • dirty

        protected boolean dirty
        indicates whether the raw byte buffer contains the same values as the the frame body's data members. ie, whether a user has modified the frame body's values, and if so, whether have been saved back to the raw byte buffer.

      • frameType

        protected FrameType frameType
        the frame type which is used by derived classes when creating error messages.

        constructor. called when reading in an existing frame body from an .mp3 file.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - input stream pointing to a frame body in the .mp3 file.
        frameType - the type of ID3v2.4 frame to create.
        frameBodySize - size (in bytes) of the frame's body.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error while reading in the frame body.

               java.lang.String invalidFrameId,
               int frameBodySize)
                throws java.io.IOException
        constructor. called when reading in an existing invalid frame body from an .mp3 file. this allows invalid frames to be read in and skipped over in an attempt to read in the remaining valid frames.
        Parameters:
        inputStream - input stream pointing to a frame body in the .mp3 file.
        invalidFrameId - the id of the invalid frame.
        frameBodySize - size (in bytes) of the frame's body.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if there is an error while reading in the frame body.

      • getNextNullTerminator

        protected int getNextNullTerminator(int startingFrom,
                        Encoding encoding)
        finds the next null terminating character according to the character encoding in the raw data stream.
        Parameters:
        startingFrom - the index at which to start searching from in the buffer.
        encoding - the character set used to encode the string (and hence determine the null terminating character).

        Returns:
        the index of the next null terminator in the data.

      • parse

        public void parse()
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        parses the raw bytes of the frame body and stores the parsed values in the frame body's fields.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if an invalid value is detected while parsing the frame body's raw bytes.

      • setBuffer

        public void setBuffer()
        If the frame body's values have been modified, then resize the raw byte buffer and store the new values there. When finished, the dirty flag is reset to indicate that the buffer is up to date, and the frame is now ready to be saved to the .mp3 file.

        this method should be abstract. However, the ID3v24Frame constructor needs to be able to instanitate instances of a frame body in the case where it encounters an invalid frame. For this reason, this method was made concrete, and simply throws an exception if it is ever called in this base class. However, derived classes implement this method to correctly update the raw byte buffer.

      • save

        public void save(java.io.OutputStream outputStream)
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                 java.io.IOException
        save the frame body to the .mp3 file.
        Parameters:
        outputStream - an output stream pointing to where the next frame body should be written.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the any of the frame body's values have been modified, then the setBuffer() method must be called prior to calling save() in order to save the modifications to the frame body's raw byte buffer.
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while writing the raw byte data in the buffer to the file.

      • save

        public void save(java.io.RandomAccessFile file)
          throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                 java.io.IOException
        save the frame body to the .mp3 file.
        Parameters:
        file - a random access file pointing to where the next frame body should be written.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the any of the frame body's values have been modified, then the setBuffer() method must be called prior to calling save() in order to save the modifications to the frame body's raw byte buffer.
        java.io.IOException - if an error occurs while writing the raw byte data in the buffer to the file.
